channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Summarizing Videos using Concentrated Attention and Considering the Uniqueness and Diversity of the Video Frames
item.description: Instead of simply modeling the frames' dependencies based on global attention, our method integrates a concentrated attention mechanism that is able to focus on non-overlapping blocks in the main diagonal of the attention matrix, and to enrich the existing information by extracting and exploiting knowledge about the uniqueness and diversity of the associated frames of the video.

item.title: Smart Data Collection System for Brownfield CNC Milling Machines: A New Benchmark Dataset for Data-Driven Machine Monitoring
item.description: To enhance the scalability of machine learning in real-world applications, this paper presents a benchmark dataset for process monitoring of brownfield milling machines based on acceleration data.

item.title: Pedestrian 3D Bounding Box Prediction
item.description: Safety is still the main issue of autonomous driving, and in order to be globally deployed, they need to predict pedestrians' motions sufficiently in advance.

item.title: On the Impact of Noises in Crowd-Sourced Data for Speech Translation
item.description: Training speech translation (ST) models requires large and high-quality datasets.

item.title: Learning Symmetric Rules with SATNet
item.description: SATNet is a differentiable constraint solver with a custom backpropagation algorithm, which can be used as a layer in a deep-learning system.

item.title: TTS-CGAN: A Transformer Time-Series Conditional GAN for Biosignal Data Augmentation
item.description: For time-series data, the suite of data augmentation strategies we can use to expand the size of the dataset is limited by the need to maintain the basic properties of the signal.

item.title: Simplifying Dataflow Dialogue Design
item.description: This paper argues that this perception is wrong: 1) Suggestions for a simplified format for the annotation of the dataset are presented, 2) An implementation of the DF execution engine is released\footnote{https://github. com/telepathylabsai/OpenDF}, which can serve as a sandbox allowing researchers to easily implement, and experiment with, new DF dialogue designs.

item.title: Show Me Your Face, And I'll Tell You How You Speak
item.description: When we speak, the prosody and content of the speech can be inferred from the movement of our lips.

item.title: SSL-Lanes: Self-Supervised Learning for Motion Forecasting in Autonomous Driving
item.description: Self-supervised learning (SSL) is an emerging technique that has been successfully employed to train convolutional neural networks (CNNs) and graph neural networks (GNNs) for more transferable, generalizable, and robust representation learning.

item.title: Learning Gait Representation from Massive Unlabelled Walking Videos: A Benchmark
item.description: As far as we know, GaitLU-1M is the first large-scale unlabelled gait dataset, and GaitSSB is the first method that achieves remarkable unsupervised results on the aforementioned benchmarks.

item.title: Comparing and extending the use of defeasible argumentation with quantitative data in real-world contexts
item.description: Computational trust was selected as the domain of application of such models.

item.title: Extended U-Net for Speaker Verification in Noisy Environments
item.description: Background noise is a well-known factor that deteriorates the accuracy and reliability of speaker verification (SV) systems by blurring speech intelligibility.

item.title: RankSEG: A Consistent Ranking-based Framework for Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we establish a theoretical foundation of segmentation with respect to the Dice/IoU metrics, including the Bayes rule and Dice/IoU-calibration, analogous to classification-calibration or Fisher consistency in classification.

item.title: Simplifying Semantic Annotations of SMCalFlow
item.description: SMCalFlow is a large corpus of semantically detailed annotations of task-oriented natural dialogues.

item.title: Local Evaluation of Time Series Anomaly Detection Algorithms
item.description: In recent years, specific evaluation metrics for time series anomaly detection algorithms have been developed to handle the limitations of the classical precision and recall.

item.title: RES: A Robust Framework for Guiding Visual Explanation
item.description: Despite the fast progress of explanation techniques in modern Deep Neural Networks (DNNs) where the main focus is handling "how to generate the explanations", advanced research questions that examine the quality of the explanation itself (e. g., "whether the explanations are accurate") and improve the explanation quality (e. g., "how to adjust the model to generate more accurate explanations when explanations are inaccurate") are still relatively under-explored.

item.title: Diffusion Deformable Model for 4D Temporal Medical Image Generation
item.description: Our proposed DDM is composed of the diffusion and the deformation modules so that DDM can learn spatial deformation information between the source and target volumes and provide a latent code for generating intermediate frames along a geodesic path.

item.title: MGNet: Monocular Geometric Scene Understanding for Autonomous Driving
item.description: We define monocular geometric scene understanding as the combination of two known tasks: Panoptic segmentation and self-supervised monocular depth estimation.

item.title: Consistency-preserving Visual Question Answering in Medical Imaging
item.description: Visual Question Answering (VQA) models take an image and a natural-language question as input and infer the answer to the question.

item.title: Learning with Weak Annotations for Robust Maritime Obstacle Detection
item.description: Experiments show that maritime obstacle segmentation networks trained using SLR on weak labels not only match, but outperform the same networks trained with dense ground truth labels, which is a remarkable result.

item.title: Kernel Attention Transformer (KAT) for Histopathology Whole Slide Image Classification
item.description: Transformer has been widely used in histopathology whole slide image (WSI) classification for the purpose of tumor grading, prognosis analysis, etc.

item.title: SARNet: Semantic Augmented Registration of Large-Scale Urban Point Clouds
item.description: Registering urban point clouds is a quite challenging task due to the large-scale, noise and data incompleteness of LiDAR scanning data.

item.title: Multi-Scale Spatial Temporal Graph Convolutional Network for Skeleton-Based Action Recognition
item.description: To solve this problem, we present a multi-scale spatial graph convolution (MS-GC) module and a multi-scale temporal graph convolution (MT-GC) module to enrich the receptive field of the model in spatial and temporal dimensions.

item.title: Lesion-Aware Contrastive Representation Learning for Histopathology Whole Slide Images Analysis
item.description: In this paper, we proposed a novel contrastive representation learning framework named Lesion-Aware Contrastive Learning (LACL) for histopathology whole slide image analysis.

item.title: Key-frame Guided Network for Thyroid Nodule Recognition using Ultrasound Videos
item.description: Ultrasound examination is widely used in the clinical diagnosis of thyroid nodules (benign/malignant).

item.title: Learn Fast, Segment Well: Fast Object Segmentation Learning on the iCub Robot
item.description: In this work, we focus on the instance segmentation task and provide a comprehensive study of different techniques that allow adapting an object segmentation model in presence of novel objects or different domains.

item.title: Self-supervised Learning in Remote Sensing: A Review
item.description: In deep learning research, self-supervised learning (SSL) has received great attention triggering interest within both the computer vision and remote sensing communities.

item.title: Iso-CapsNet: Isomorphic Capsule Network for Brain Graph Representation Learning
item.description: Brain graph representation learning serves as the fundamental technique for brain diseases diagnosis.

item.title: Prior-Guided One-shot Neural Architecture Search
item.description: In this paper, we present Prior-Guided One-shot NAS (PGONAS) to strengthen the ranking correlation of supernets.

item.title: Distributional Gaussian Processes Layers for Out-of-Distribution Detection
item.description: Moreover, by applying the same segmentation model to out-of-distribution data (i. e., images with pathology such as brain tumors), we show that our uncertainty estimates result in out-of-distribution detection that outperforms the capabilities of previous Bayesian networks and reconstruction-based approaches that learn normative distributions.

item.title: Analyzing Encoded Concepts in Transformer Language Models
item.description: We propose a novel framework ConceptX, to analyze how latent concepts are encoded in representations learned within pre-trained language models.

item.title: Zero Stability Well Predicts Performance of Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: We first give the interpretation of zero stability in the context of deep learning and then investigate the performance of existing first- and second-order CNNs under different zero-stable circumstances.

item.title: Enhancing Stochastic Petri Net-based Remaining Time Prediction using k-Nearest Neighbors
item.description: For realising timely delivery, an accurate prediction of the remaining time of the delivery process is crucial.

item.title: Insights into Deep Non-linear Filters for Improved Multi-channel Speech Enhancement
item.description: The key advantage of using multiple microphones for speech enhancement is that spatial filtering can be used to complement the tempo-spectral processing.

item.title: IBISCape: A Simulated Benchmark for multi-modal SLAM Systems Evaluation in Large-scale Dynamic Environments
item.description: Keywords: benchmark, multi-modal, datasets, Odometry, Calibration, DVS, SLAM

item.title: When to Trust Your Simulator: Dynamics-Aware Hybrid Offline-and-Online Reinforcement Learning
item.description: This brings up a new question: is it possible to combine learning from limited real data in offline RL and unrestricted exploration through imperfect simulators in online RL to address the drawbacks of both approaches?

item.title: iExam: A Novel Online Exam Monitoring and Analysis System Based on Face Detection and Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we propose iExam, an intelligent online exam monitoring and analysis system that can not only use face detection to assist invigilators in real-time student identification, but also be able to detect common abnormal behaviors (including face disappearing, rotating faces, and replacing with a different person during the exams) via a face recognition-based post-exam video analysis.

item.title: Learning to Control Local Search for Combinatorial Optimization
item.description: Combinatorial optimization problems are encountered in many practical contexts such as logistics and production, but exact solutions are particularly difficult to find and usually NP-hard for considerable problem sizes.

item.title: Split Localized Conformal Prediction
item.description: The modified score inherits the spirit of split conformal methods, which is simple and efficient compared with full conformal methods but better approximates conditional coverage guarantee.

item.title: Learning Deep Input-Output Stable Dynamics
item.description: We propose a method to learn nonlinear systems guaranteeing the input-output stability.

item.title: Learning Deep Feature Correspondence for Unsupervised Anomaly Detection and Segmentation
item.description: We develop our DFC in an asymmetric dual network framework that consists of a generic feature extraction network and an elaborated feature estimation network, and detect the possible anomalies within images by modeling and evaluating the associated deep feature correspondence between the two dual network branches.

item.title: A penalisation method for batch multi-objective Bayesian optimisation with application in heat exchanger design
item.description: We present HIghly Parallelisable Pareto Optimisation (HIPPO) -- a batch acquisition function that enables multi-objective Bayesian optimisation methods to efficiently exploit parallel processing resources.

item.title: Thermodynamics of Interpretation
item.description: Over the past few years, different types of data-driven Artificial Intelligence (AI) techniques have been widely adopted in various domains of science for generating predictive black-box models.

item.title: Continual Learning of Dynamical Systems with Competitive Federated Reservoir Computing
item.description: Our results suggest that reservoir computing is a promising candidate framework for the continual learning of dynamical systems.

item.title: Discrete Morse Sandwich: Fast Computation of Persistence Diagrams for Scalar Data -- An Algorithm and A Benchmark
item.description: This fast processing of the dimensions 0 and (d-1) further reduces, and drastically, the number of critical simplices to consider for the computation of $D_1(f)$, the intermediate layer of the sandwich.

item.title: Omni-Seg+: A Scale-aware Dynamic Network for Pathological Image Segmentation
item.description: The contribution of this paper is three-fold: (1) a novel scale-aware controller is proposed to generalize the dynamic neural network from single-scale to multi-scale; (2) semi-supervised consistency regularization of pseudo-labels is introduced to model the inter-scale correlation of unannotated tissue types into a single end-to-end learning paradigm; and (3) superior scale-aware generalization is evidenced by directly applying a model trained on human kidney images to mouse kidney images, without retraining.

item.title: Supernova Light Curves Approximation based on Neural Network Models
item.description: Normalizing Flows exceeds Gaussian processes in terms of approximation quality as well.

item.title: Interpretable Acoustic Representation Learning on Breathing and Speech Signals for COVID-19 Detection
item.description: In this paper, we describe an approach for representation learning of audio signals for the task of COVID-19 detection.

item.title: Uncertainty Calibration for Deep Audio Classifiers
item.description: In this work, we investigate the uncertainty calibration for deep audio classifiers.

item.title: An Empirical Study of Personalized Federated Learning
item.description: Federated learning is a distributed machine learning approach in which a single server and multiple clients collaboratively build machine learning models without sharing datasets on clients.
